|brand = Buffalo |model = WHR-300 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = HP |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N300 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = FDI-09101621-0 |icid = 6102A-025 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Atheros;AR7240; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24Kc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 400 <!-- 350 / 400 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 10:6F:3F |oui = 10:6F:3F
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 4.0 |pwr_barrel_inner = 1.7 |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = high power |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.11.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = BUFFALO-XXXXXX |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = auto |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 07/21/2009 |estreldate = 09/05/2012 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 747464126036 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0096239EC |asin_country = US |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9283;AR9283-AL1A; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device appears to be identical (or near identical) to the [[Buffalo WHR-HP-G300N]]. <!-- there is a v2? -->
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.speedguide.net/routers/buffalo-whr-300hp-airstation-highpower-n300-wireless-2535 On SpeedGuide.net]
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Third Party Firmware=== <small> The WHR-300HP ships with the Buffalo "User Friendly" firmware build, which will not install third-party firmware. *The Buffalo "Pro" firmware build must be installed on the WHR-300HP before upgrading to DD-WRT or any other third-party firmware.
:# Download and unzip the [http://www.buffalotech.com/support-and-downloads/download/whr-series_sw106.zip CD image for WHR Series wireless router] from Buffalo. :# Install the ''\whr-series_sw106\Firmware\WHR-300HP\Professional_v24sp2-19438.enc'' firmware image on the WHR-300HP. :# Doing this resets the WHR-300HP to factory defaults. (IP=192.168.11.1 Username=admin Password=password) :# Install a regular DD-WRT firmware image for the WHR-HP-G300N on the WHR-300HP. *Builds compatible with the WHR-HP-G300N: :-[ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/betas/2017/06-01-2017-r32170/buffalo_whr_hp_g300n/whr-hp-g300n-firmware-MULTI.bin DD-WRT v3.0-r32170 std (06/01/17)] :-[ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/betas/2017/04-06-2017-r31825/buffalo_whr_hp_g300n/whr-hp-g300n-firmware-MULTI.bin DD-WRT v3.0-r31825 std (04/06/17)] :N.B. The previously recommended build, (r24461) prevented upgrading or downgrading the firmware. If stuck, follow the fix instructions [http://www.askmeaboutlinux.com/?p=2819 here ]. *The [http://downloads.openwrt.org/barrier_breaker/14.07-rc2/ar71xx/generic/openwrt-ar71xx-generic-whr-hp-g300n-squashfs-factory.bin OpenWrt BarrierBreaker 14.07-rc2] build for the WHR-HP-G300N is compatible with the :WHR-300HP, but the internal flash is too small to install the Luci web management interface. </small>
==Notes== ===Probable PSU(s)=== The power supply shown in the above image is an ''Asian Power Devices'' WA-10H05FU. :The one shown in the FCC external photos is a ''Buffalo''-branded US100523.
[[File:Whr-300hp adaptor bottom.jpg|150px]] {{#set:Has images=external|Has images=power supply}}
